meanings.definition: The flat, movable bone at the front of the knee joint.
meanings.sent1: I felt a sharp pain in my kneecap when I fell.
meanings.sent2: The doctor gently touched my kneecap during the examination.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bumped my kneecap on the table, ouch!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a polished kneecap.
meanings.sent5: The kneecap acts like a protective shield for the knee joint.

meanings.definition: To hit someone on the kneecap with a blunt object.
meanings.sent1: He kneecapped the criminal to stop him from running away.
meanings.sent2: The villain planned to kneecap his rival in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would kneecap anyone who spoiled the ending.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news kneecapped their hopes for a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal felt like a sudden kneecap in the middle of a dance.
